query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Come si volgon per tenera nube 11 due archi paralelli e concolori, 12 quando Iunone a sua ancella iube,
13 nascendo di quel d’entro quel di fori, 14 a guisa del parlar di quella vaga 15 ch’amor consunse come sol vapori,
16 e fanno qui la gente esser presaga, 17 per lo patto che Dio con Noè puose, 18 del mondo che già mai più non s’allaga:
19 così di quelle sempiterne rose 20 volgiensi circa noi le due ghirlande, 21 e sì l’estrema a l’intima rispuose.
query.result:
**English:**
10 As through a tender cloud two bows 11 parallel and of the same color turn, 12 when Juno commands her handmaid,
13 the one on the outside being born from the one on the inside, 14 in the manner of the speech of that fair one 15 whom love consumed like the sun consumes vapors,
16 and here they make people prescient, 17 because of the pact that God made with Noah, 18 that the world will never again be flooded:
19 so around us the two garlands 20 of those eternal roses turned, 21 and so the outermost responded to the innermost.
**Cornish:**
10 Kevel dell yw trohevel a-dreus kowlennow tyner 11 dew ark paralek ha'gas an keth liw, 12 pan a lever Iunon dhe'y morvoren,
13 an onan a-ves a'n onan a-dhiwedh, 14 kevel lavarow an onan melyon hyn 15 a wra karanteth gans karanteth gans an karanteth,
16 ha'gas wra hynma an dus presadow, 17 rag an konvenans a wra gwrys gans Duw dhe Noe, 18 namna an bys nyns yw dhe vosa moy.
19 Kevel henna an rosow sempiternel hyn 20 a wra trohevel a-dro dhe ni an dew gorlann, 21 ha'gas an onan a-ves a wra leverel dhe'n onan a-dhiwedh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Degno è che, dov’ è l’un, l’altro s’induca: 35 sì che, com’ elli ad una militaro, 36 così la gloria loro insieme luca.
query.result:
**English:**
34 It is fitting that where one is, the other should be brought in: 35 so that, just as they fought together, 36 so their glory may shine together.
**Cornish:**
34 Dyg yw, le mayth yw unn, an erel dhe vos gwrys: 35 marnas, kevel orth unn a wra'th dhe vresel, 36 kevel henna aga glowr a wra sklerel yn-mes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 L’essercito di Cristo, che sì caro 38 costò a rïarmar, dietro a la ’nsegna 39 si movea tardo, sospeccioso e raro,
40 quando lo ’mperador che sempre regna 41 provide a la milizia, ch’era in forse, 42 per sola grazia, non per esser degna;
43 e, come è detto, a sua sposa soccorse 44 con due campioni, al cui fare, al cui dire 45 lo popol disvïato si raccorse.
query.result:
**English:**
37 The army of Christ, which cost so dear 38 to rearm, behind the standard 39 moved slowly, hesitant and sparse,
40 when the emperor who always reigns 41 provided for the army, which was in doubt, 42 by grace alone, not because it was worthy;
43 and, as it is said, he came to the aid of his bride 44 with two champions, by whose deeds and words 45 the straying people were brought back together.
**Cornish:**
37 An sojorya a'n Krist, a wra gans ker 38 dhe'y arvera, wosa an baner 39 a wra movyans a-dhiwedhes, dowtus ha pur,
40 pan an emperour a wra reynna byth 41 a wra purvys dhe'n sojorya, a wra y'n dowt, 42 rag gras hepken, nyns rag bos dyg;
43 ha, kevel yw leverys, dhe'y spous a wra gwrys skoes 44 gans dew kampyon, rag aga ober, rag aga lavar 45 an dus a wra disvyys a wra gwrys dhe vos onan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 In quella parte ove surge ad aprire 47 Zefiro dolce le novelle fronde 48 di che si vede Europa rivestire,
49 non molto lungi al percuoter de l’onde 50 dietro a le quali, per la lunga foga, 51 lo sol talvolta ad ogne uom si nasconde,
52 siede la fortunata Calaroga 53 sotto la protezion del grande scudo 54 in che soggiace il leone e soggioga:
55 dentro vi nacque l’amoroso drudo 56 de la fede cristiana, il santo atleta 57 benigno a’ suoi e a’ nemici crudo;
58 e come fu creata, fu repleta 59 sì la sua mente di viva vertute 60 che, ne la madre, lei fece profeta.
query.result:
**English:**
46 In that part where Zephyr rises to open 47 the new leaves 48 with which Europe is seen to be reclothed,
49 not far from the beating of the waves 50 behind which, because of the long pursuit, 51 the sun sometimes hides from every man,
52 sits fortunate Calaroga 53 under the protection of the great shield 54 in which the lion is subject and subjugates:
55 within it was born the loving lover 56 of the Christian faith, the holy athlete 57 kind to his own and cruel to his enemies;
58 and as he was created, so was he filled 59 with such living virtue 60 that, in his mother, it made her a prophet.
**Cornish:**
46 Y'n an rann hyn le mayth Zefir a wra leverel dhe agora 47 an deliow nowydh melyon 48 a wra gweles Europa dhe vos gwiskes,
49 nyns oedh moy bell dhe'n golpya an tonnow 50 wosa henna, rag an hir brys, 51 an howl a wra'n gweles moyth dhe bub den,
52 a wra sevel an Kalaroga lowen 53 a-ji dhe'n difens a'n skoed meur 54 y'n keth an leon a wra sojya ha sojya:
55 a-mes henna a wra genys an karanteth melyon 56 a'n feyth Kristyon, an athlet sans 57 melyon dhe'y dus ha dhe'y enebow krys;
58 ha kevel oedh kreys, oedh leun 59 y'n poynt gans vertu byw 60 a wra gwrys, y'n y vam, profet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Poi che le sponsalizie fuor compiute 62 al sacro fonte intra lui e la Fede, 63 u’ si dotar di mutüa salute,
64 la donna che per lui l’assenso diede, 65 vide nel sonno il mirabile frutto 66 ch’uscir dovea di lui e de le rede;
67 e perché fosse qual era in costrutto, 68 quinci si mosse spirito a nomarlo 69 del possessivo di cui era tutto.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Domenico fu detto; e io ne parlo 71 sì come de l’agricola che Cristo 72 elesse a l’orto suo per aiutarlo.
query.result: **English:**70Dominicwascalled;andIspeakofhim71justasofthefarmerwhomChrist72choseinhisgardentohelphim.**Cornish:**70Domenik o veu gelwys; ha my a wravia 71 keparhagrikolyor a dhewisis Krist 72 yn y orth ytho dhe'y gweres orth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Ben parve messo e famigliar di Cristo: 74 che ’l primo amor che ’n lui fu manifesto, 75 fu al primo consiglio che diè Cristo.
query.result: **English:**73HewasclearlyaselectedandfamiliarservanttoChrist:74forthefirstlovethatwasmanifestinhim,75wasatthefirstcounselthatChristgave.**Cornish:**73Ev a veu kler ow selys ha familys dhe Krist: 74 rag an kynsa karanteth a veu kler ytho, 75 veu y'n kynsa konsil a ro's Krist.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Spesse fïate fu tacito e desto 77 trovato in terra da la sua nutrice, 78 come dicesse: ‘Io son venuto a questo’.
query.result: **English:**76Oftentimeshewasfoundsilentandawake77onthegroundbyhishandmaid,78asseemingtosay:‘Ihavecomeforthis’.**Cornish:**76Liesoweth veu ev tewes ha des 77 kavos war an nor gans y voesva, 78 kepar hag ev leveris: ‘My a dheuth rag hemma’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Oh padre suo veramente Felice! 80 oh madre sua veramente Giovanna, 81 se, interpretata, val come si dice!
82 Non per lo mondo, per cui mo s’affanna 83 di retro ad Ostïense e a Taddeo, 84 ma per amor de la verace manna
85 in picciol tempo gran dottor si feo; 86 tal che si mise a circüir la vigna 87 che tosto imbianca, se ’l vignaio è reo.
query.result:
**English:**
79 Oh his father truly happy! 80 Oh his mother truly Joan, 81 if, interpreted, it is worth as much as is said!
82 Not for the world, for which now they toil 83 behind Ostiense and Taddeo, 84 but for love of the true manna
85 in a short time he became a great doctor; 86 so much so that he set out to go around the vineyard 87 that quickly turns white, if the vine-dresser is bad.
**Cornish:**
79 O tas ow bennathas lowen! 80 O mam ow bennathas Jowan, 81 mar, dallethys, yw gwir an lavar!
82 Nyns rag an bys, rag yw poos owth poen, 83 wosa Ostiense ha Taddeo, 84 mes rag karanteth an vonna gwir.
85 Yn termyn byghan ev a veu doktor bras; 86 kepar ha bosas ev a-dro dhe'n winnick 87 hag a wra dhammlow byghan mar yw'n winnickour drog.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 E a la sedia che fu già benigna 89 più a’ poveri giusti, non per lei, 90 ma per colui che siede, che traligna,
91 non dispensare o due o tre per sei, 92 non la fortuna di prima vacante, 93 non decimas, quae sunt pauperum Dei,
94 addimandò, ma contro al mondo errante 95 licenza di combatter per lo seme 96 del qual ti fascian ventiquattro piante.
query.result:
**English:**
88 And for the seat that was once kind 89 to the just poor, not for itself, 90 but for him who sits there, who degenerates,
91 he did not ask to dispense two or three for six, 92 nor the fortune of the first vacancy, 93 nor tithes, which are the due of God’s poor,
94 but asked for license to fight against the erring world 95 for the seed 96 of which twenty-four plants make a garland for you.
**Cornish:**
88 Ha'n sedh o veu unnik bys 89 dhe'n beurow just, nyns ragti, 90 mes rag an neb a-sit eno, hag a wra drog.
91 Nyns a wynn ev dhe daskorhe dhew rag whegh, 92 nag an jentyn a'n kynsa gwag, 93 nag degow, an peth yw dledhek dhe Dhew,
94 mes ev a wynn, orth an bys ow poos, 95 les dhe janjya rag an had 96 a-ugh dheugens planntys a wra goron dhys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Di lui si fecer poi diversi rivi 104 onde l’orto catolico si riga, 105 sì che i suoi arbuscelli stan più vivi.
query.result:
**English:**
103 From him then flowed diverse streams 104 with which the Catholic garden is watered, 105 so that its shrubs stand more lively.
**Cornish:**
103 A-dhyworth ev y feu lies dyffrans 104 rag aga an ort katolik yw dowr, 105 kepar ha bos y'n prennow moy byw.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Se tal fu l’una rota de la biga 107 in che la Santa Chiesa si difese 108 e vinse in campo la sua civil briga,
109 ben ti dovrebbe assai esser palese 110 l’eccellenza de l’altra, di cui Tomma 111 dinanzi al mio venir fu sì cortese.
query.result:
**English:**
106 If such was one wheel of the chariot 107 in which the Holy Church defended herself 108 and won her civil strife in the field,
109 it should be very clear to you 110 the excellence of the other, of which Thomas 111 was so courteous to me before my coming.
**Cornish:**
106 Mar henna veu unn a'n dhew golgh a'n kar 107 yn aga an Eglos Sans owth difenn, 108 ha'n mayn owth kolla y'n stryf sivil,
109 yth wra dhe dhys dhe weles yn klear 110 an excellens a'n nessa, a-ugh Tommas 111 veu dhe'm bys owth karow bys owth dos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Ma l’orbita che fé la parte somma 113 di sua circunferenza, è derelitta, 114 sì ch’è la muffa dov’ era la gromma.
query.result:
**English:**
112 But the orbit that made the highest part 113 of its circumference is abandoned, 114 so that there is mold where there was the eyelet.
**Cornish:**
112 Mes an fordh a wrug an rann ughella 113 a'y golgh, yw trehedhys, 114 kepar ha bos an mof le may o'n gromma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Io son la vita di Bonaventura 128 da Bagnoregio, che ne’ grandi offici 129 sempre pospuosi la sinistra cura.
query.result:
**English:**
127 I am the life of Bonaventure 128 from Bagnoregio, who in the great offices 129 always put aside the care for the left.
**Cornish:**
127 My yw bywnans Bonaventura 128 a Vanerow, neb yn an offisow brassa 129 ev a wrug byth pospya an gowesow klew.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Illuminato e Augustin son quici, 131 che fuor de’ primi scalzi poverelli 132 che nel capestro a Dio si fero amici.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Illuminato and Augustine are here, 131 who were among the first barefoot poor men 132 who in the capuche made themselves friends with God.
**Cornish:**
130 Illuminato ha Awstin yw ama, 131 a veu ynter an kynsa beurow drog 132 a wrug yn an kapester frendys gans Dhew.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Rabano è qui, e lucemi dallato 140 il calavrese abate Giovacchino 141 di spirito profetico dotato.
query.result:
**English:**
139 Rabanus is here, and beside me shines 140 the Calabrian abbot Joachim 141 endowed with prophetic spirit.
**Cornish:**
139 Rabano yw ena, ha'm golow 140 an abad Calabrian, Giovacchino 141 gans spyrys profwydh.
